questions.question: What is the current version of TLS widely used today?
questions.explanation: TLS 1.3 is the latest version, offering improved security and performance over previous versions.

questions.question: What does HSTS force browsers to do?
questions.explanation: HTTP Strict Transport Security forces browsers to connect only via HTTPS, preventing downgrade attacks.

questions.question: What certificate validation issue allows attackers to impersonate websites?
questions.explanation: Certificate spoofing uses fraudulent certificates to intercept encrypted communications by impersonating legitimate sites.

questions.question: What IPsec mode encrypts only the payload, not the IP header?
questions.explanation: Transport mode encrypts only the data payload, used for end-to-end communication between hosts.

questions.question: What IPsec mode encrypts the entire IP packet including headers?
questions.explanation: Tunnel mode encapsulates and encrypts the entire packet, commonly used for VPN gateway-to-gateway connections.

questions.question: What protocol provides both authentication and encryption services in IPsec?
questions.explanation: ESP provides confidentiality, authentication, and integrity for IPsec communications.

questions.question: What is the successor to WPA2 for wireless security?
questions.explanation: WPA3 improves on WPA2 with stronger encryption, protection against offline dictionary attacks, and forward secrecy.

questions.question: What protocol verifies email sender authenticity using DNS records?
questions.explanation: SPF allows domain owners to specify which mail servers can send email on their behalf, preventing spoofing.

questions.question: What secure DNS protocol encrypts DNS queries?
questions.explanation: DoH (DNS over HTTPS) encrypts DNS queries to prevent eavesdropping and manipulation.

questions.question: What mechanism allows websites to declare they should only be accessed via HTTPS?
questions.explanation: HSTS tells browsers to only connect to the site over HTTPS, even if users type http:// in the address bar.
